title: How do I mark a message that TB (Windows) has put in the spam folder as not spam?
content: TB Windows puts some messages in my spam folder even though I've put the addresses in my contacts and told it to check contacts before moving them to spam folder. It would be nice if the "Spam" button became a "not Spam" button.
creator: aladdin2

title: Exporting email data

title: Links in Thunderbird emails

When i receive email with linkages i am getting this reply when link is used

title: Reminders 4 hours late...
content:
Hi, my Thunderbird calendar reminders are coming up 4 hours after the meeting.

Running Kubuntu. System locale/timezone OK, TBird set to use system time (though manually making it the same didn't help). HW Clock matches system time. Pacific/Auckland.

Tried exporting all my appointments and re-importing them - no change.
creator: yard1

title: Trouble Adding Gmail to Thunderbird – Urgent Help Needed
content:
Hi All,

My name is Chris and I’ve been struggling for the past 3 days to add my Gmail account into Mozilla Thunderbird, and it’s become urgent. My computer often crashes and freezes, so I deleted my Gmail from an earlier version of Thunderbird and reinstalled the latest version.

When I try to add the account, Thunderbird just says “Looking up configuration of my Gmail” and never completes the setup. Oddly enough, I was able to add the same Gmail account into Outlook without any issues.

Is there something wrong with Thunderbird’s automatic server configuration for Gmail?

On top of that, I’d like to download all my past Gmail emails (sent items and inbox storage) into Thunderbird, but I don’t know the correct manual settings to use.

Any guidance on fixing the account setup and the proper manual IMAP/POP settings would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance, Chris
creator: chris.carragher1977

title: Archive removal
content: A large amount of archives adds unnecessary storage load. I want to move these out of my active files and onto a remote USB stick. How do I do this?
creator: peterdev

title: Moving email (which are in folders) from an old computer to a new computer
content:
I just bought a new computer. I would like to move my emails from my old computer to my new computer. I downloaded Thunderbird and I tried setting up my emails on my new computer, but it only took the emails that were in my in box on my 'server.' I also had subfolders in my inbox with emails in them, and none of the subfolders or emails in the subfolders moved over.

My email provider is Shaw, and my old computer I used the pop 3 format. On the new computer I'm using the IMAP format.

I have just watched the video on the support page - Move Thunderbird data to a new computer. I don't know if this is something I should do....is it my only choice....or is there something you can suggest.
creator: marinagosselin

title: all sent folders renamed to sent
content: Since today (Version 146.0 Windows11 64bit) all subfolders, which are configured to send emails from (e.g. name+test@example.com for folder test) are renamend to the german word "Gesendet" for Sent. You can see that in the second screenshot. In the first screenshot you can see the name "Gesendet" which is locked against changes and the normal name of the folder is support in this case. I don't know, what has changed to yesterday. And as I'm using this feature intensivly, the "Gesendet" over all folders is quite annoying.
creator: oliver49

title: Adding Gmail to thunderbird Af
content: After a major windows upgrade crash on a brand new laptop turned in into a brick, Thunderbird was installed at the time and all of my email accounts were working fine. I contacted PCs support team and they agreed to replace it with a new one. All Windows and other relevant updates were done before anything else. Then I started the process of installing the program's that I wanted to use. When I came Thunderbird it installed okay, I added 2 of my email accounts and they work fine. Then I tried to add my Gmail account got through adding server settings then I am asked log in to my Google account where upon I am met with a pop up window with a broken robot an error code 400 and message This should not be repeated, Am I doing something wrong or is there a glitch with Thunderbird. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Brian
creator: mumblesbrian1

title: Ctr-C no longer works
content: Hi! Since one of the last updates, Ctr-C no longer works. My actual release is 146.0 (64-Bit) How can I get it back? Thanks in advance Frank
creator: fspade

title: Sähköpostin lähettäminen ei onnistu ilmeisesti Thunderbirdin päivityksen jälkeen (Version 140.6.0esr)
content:
Sähköpostien saapuminen takkuaa. Sähköpostin lähettäminen ei onnistu. Saapuneen sähköpostin edelleen lähettäminen ei onnistu.

Sähköposti näyttäisi toimivan selaimen (Firefox) kautta (https://app.inet.fi/?... jne)

Myös vaimollani on samat ongelmat, vaikka hän toimii oman läppärinsä avulla ja hänellä on oma sähköpostiosoite.

Minun sähköpostiosoitteeni on juhani.lahtinen@pp.inet.fi
creator: juhani.lahtinen
